description: Corosync through 3.1.9, if encryption is disabled or the attacker knows the encryption key, has a stack-based buffer overflow in orf_token_endian_convert in exec/totemsrp.c via a large UDP packet.
summary: This vulnerability in Corosync versions up to 3.1.9 allows an attacker to cause a stack-based buffer overflow by sending a large UDP packet if encryption is disabled or if the attacker knows the encryption key. This could result in remote code execution and potentially compromise the system. Users should update to the latest version of Corosync to mitigate this threat and enable encryption to add an extra layer of security.

description: The Motors – Car Dealer, Classifieds & Listing plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to unauthorized modification of data due to a missing capability checks on the motors_create_template and motors_delete_template functions in all versions up to, and including, 1.4.57. This makes it possible for authenticated attackers, with Subscriber-level access and above, to delete arbitrary posts or create listing templates. This issue requires Elementor plugin to be installed, which is a required plugin for Motors Starter Theme.
summary: This vulnerability in the Motors – Car Dealer plugin for WordPress allows attackers with certain access levels to delete posts or create listing templates without permission. To stay safe, users should update the plugin to version 1.4.58 or higher when available.
software: Motors – Car Dealer, Classifieds & Listing plugin

description: The Newsletters plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to Reflected Cross-Site Scripting via the "to" parameter in all versions up to, and including, 4.9.9.7 due to insufficient input sanitization and output escaping. This makes it possible for unauthenticated attackers to inject arbitrary web scripts in pages that execute if they can successfully trick an admin user into performing an action such as clicking on a link.
summary: The Newsletters plugin for WordPress has a security flaw that allows attackers to insert harmful scripts onto a website's pages, potentially affecting any user who clicks on a manipulated link. All versions up to 4.9.9.7 are affected. To protect against this threat, website administrators should update the plugin to the latest version to fix the vulnerability.

description: The ProfileGrid – User Profiles, Groups and Communities plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to blind and time-based SQL Injections via the rid and search parameters in all versions up to, and including, 5.9.4.7 due to insufficient escaping on the user supplied parameter and lack of sufficient preparation on the existing SQL query.  This makes it possible for authenticated attackers, with Subscriber-level access and above, to append additional SQL queries into already existing queries that can be used to extract sensitive information from the database.
summary: The ProfileGrid plugin for WordPress is at risk of SQL injections, which could allow attackers with certain levels of access to extract sensitive information from the website's database. Users of this plugin should update to version 5.9.4.8 or higher to fix this vulnerability and ensure their website's security.

description: The ProfileGrid – User Profiles, Groups and Communities plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to PHP Object Injection in all versions up to, and including, 5.9.4.5 via deserialization of untrusted input in the get_user_meta_fields_html function. This makes it possible for authenticated attackers, with Subscriber-level access and above, to inject a PHP Object. No known POP chain is present in the vulnerable software, which means this vulnerability has no impact unless another plugin or theme containing a POP chain is installed on the site. If a POP chain is present via an additional plugin or theme installed on the target system, it may allow the attacker to perform actions like delete arbitrary files, retrieve sensitive data, or execute code depending on the POP chain present.
summary: The ProfileGrid plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to a PHP Object Injection, which could allow authenticated attackers with Subscriber-level access to inject a PHP Object. This vulnerability only impacts sites that have other vulnerable plugins or themes installed that contain a specific type of exploit chain. Users of the ProfileGrid plugin should update to version 5.9.4.6 or above to mitigate this risk.
software: ProfileGrid – User Profiles, Groups and Communities plugin for WordPress

description: The ProfileGrid – User Profiles, Groups and Communities plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to unauthorized modification of data due to a missing capability check on the pm_decline_join_group_request and pm_approve_join_group_request functions in all versions up to, and including, 5.9.4.4. This makes it possible for authenticated attackers, with Subscriber-level access and above, to approve or decline join group requests which is normally should be available to administrators only.
summary: The ProfileGrid plugin for WordPress has a security vulnerability that allows attackers with certain access levels to approve or decline group join requests, which should only be possible for administrators. This affects users of the plugin running versions up to 5.9.4.4. It is recommended to update the plugin to the latest version available to fix this vulnerability.
software: ProfileGrid – User Profiles, Groups and Communities plugin for WordPress

description: The CITS Support svg, webp Media and TTF,OTF File Upload, Use Custom Fonts plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to Cross-Site Request Forgery in all versions up to, and including, 4.2. This is due to missing or incorrect nonce validation on the cits_assign_fonts_tab() function. This makes it possible for unauthenticated attackers to delete font assignments via a forged request granted they can trick a site administrator into performing an action such as clicking on a link.
summary: The vulnerability in the CITS Support plugin for WordPress allows attackers to trick a site administrator into deleting font assignments by clicking on a malicious link. This affects users of versions up to 4.2 and action should be taken to update to a secure version immediately.
software: CITS Support svg, webp Media and TTF,OTF File Upload, Use Custom Fonts plugin

description: The Your Friendly Drag and Drop Page Builder — Make Builder plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to Server-Side Request Forgery in all versions up to, and including, 1.1.10 via the make_builder_ajax_subscribe() function. This makes it possible for authenticated attackers, with Subscriber-level access and above, to make web requests to arbitrary locations originating from the web application and can be used to query and modify information from internal services.
summary: The Make Builder plugin for WordPress is at risk of a security issue called Server-Side Request Forgery, which allows attackers with certain levels of access to make unauthorized web requests and potentially access sensitive information. Anyone using versions up to 1.1.10 should update the plugin to the latest version to address this vulnerability.
software: Your Friendly Drag and Drop Page Builder

description: The CITS Support svg, webp Media and TTF,OTF File Upload, Use Custom Fonts plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to Cross-Site Request Forgery in all versions up to, and including, 4.2. This is due to missing or incorrect nonce validation on the cits_settings_tab() function. This makes it possible for unauthenticated attackers to update the plugin's settings via a forged request granted they can trick a site administrator into performing an action such as clicking on a link.
summary: The CITS Support plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to a security issue that may allow attackers to change the plugin's settings without permission. This affects users of the plugin up to version 4.2. Site administrators should update the plugin to the latest version to protect against this threat.
software: CITS Support svg, webp Media and TTF,OTF File Upload, Use Custom Fonts plugin for WordPress

description: The WooCommerce Multivendor Marketplace – REST API plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to SQL Injection via the 'id' parameter in the update_delivery_status() function in all versions up to, and including, 1.6.2 due to insufficient escaping on the user supplied parameter and lack of sufficient preparation on the existing SQL query.  This makes it possible for authenticated attackers, with Subscriber-level access and above, to append additional SQL queries into already existing queries that can be used to extract sensitive information from the database.
summary: The WooCommerce Multivendor Marketplace - REST API plugin for WordPress is at risk of a SQL Injection vulnerability that allows attackers to access sensitive information from the database. This affects all versions up to and including 1.6.2. Users with Subscriber-level access and above are able to exploit this vulnerability by manipulating the 'id' parameter in the update_delivery_status() function. To protect against this threat, users should update the plugin to the latest version as soon as possible.

description: The Block Logic – Full Gutenberg Block Display Control plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to Remote Code Execution in all versions up to, and including, 1.0.8 via the block_logic_check_logic function. This is due to the unsafe evaluation of user-controlled input. This makes it possible for authenticated attackers, with Contributor-level access and above, to execute code on the server.
summary: This vulnerability in the Block Logic plugin for WordPress allows attackers with Contributor-level access or higher to execute code on the server. Users of this plugin should update to version 1.0.9 or later to protect against this threat.
software: Block Logic – Full Gutenberg Block Display Control plugin for WordPress

description: The CryoKey plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to Reflected Cross-Site Scripting via the ‘ckemail’ parameter in all versions up to, and including, 2.4 due to insufficient input sanitization and output escaping. This makes it possible for unauthenticated attackers to inject arbitrary web scripts in pages that execute if they can successfully trick a user into performing an action such as clicking on a link.
summary: The CryoKey plugin for WordPress has a vulnerability that allows attackers to inject malicious scripts into web pages if they can trick a user into clicking on a link. This affects all versions up to 2.4 and could potentially impact any WordPress site using this plugin. Users should update to the latest version of the plugin to fix this vulnerability and prevent attacks.

description: The Code Clone plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to time-based SQL Injection via the ‘snippetId’ parameter in all versions up to, and including, 0.9 due to insufficient escaping on the user supplied parameter and lack of sufficient preparation on the existing SQL query. This makes it possible for authenticated attackers, with Administrator-level access and above, to append additional SQL queries into already existing queries that can be used to extract sensitive information from the database.
summary: The Code Clone plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to a type of cyber attack called time-based SQL Injection, which allows attackers to access sensitive information from the database. This affects users of the Code Clone plugin with versions up to 0.9. To protect against this vulnerability, users should update to the latest version of the plugin or consider disabling it if not essential for their website.

description: The Easy Custom Admin Bar plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to Reflected Cross-Site Scripting via the ‘msg’ parameter in all versions up to, and including, 1.0 due to insufficient input sanitization and output escaping. This makes it possible for unauthenticated attackers to inject arbitrary web scripts in pages that execute if they can successfully trick a user into performing an action such as clicking on a link.
summary: This vulnerability in the Easy Custom Admin Bar plugin for WordPress allows attackers to inject harmful scripts into a website if a user clicks on a malicious link. This affects all users of the plugin up to version 1.0. To protect against this threat, users should update the plugin to the latest version and avoid clicking on suspicious links.
software: Easy Custom Admin Bar plugin for WordPress

description: The Gotcha | Gesture-based Captcha plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to Reflected Cross-Site Scripting via the 'menu' parameter in all versions up to, and including, 1.0.0 due to insufficient input sanitization and output escaping. This makes it possible for unauthenticated attackers to inject arbitrary web scripts in pages that execute if they can successfully trick a user into performing an action such as clicking on a link.
summary: The Gotcha | Gesture-based Captcha plugin for WordPress has a vulnerability that allows attackers to inject harmful scripts if a user interacts with a malicious link. This affects all versions up to 1.0.0. Website owners using this plugin should update it to the latest version to protect against potential attacks.
software: Gotcha | Gesture-based Captcha plugin for WordPress

description: The Multi Video Box plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to Reflected Cross-Site Scripting via the 'video_id' and 'group_id' parameters in all versions up to, and including, 1.5.2 due to insufficient input sanitization and output escaping. This makes it possible for unauthenticated attackers to inject arbitrary web scripts in pages that execute if they can successfully trick a user into performing an action such as clicking on a link.
summary: The Multi Video Box plugin for WordPress is at risk of allowing attackers to inject harmful scripts into web pages. This affects all versions up to 1.5.2. Anyone using this plugin should update to the latest version to protect against this threat.
software: Multi Video Box plugin for WordPress

description: The Fluent Forms – Customizable Contact Forms, Survey, Quiz, & Conversational Form Builder plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to IP Address Spoofing in all versions up to, and including, 5.2.12 due to insufficient IP address validation and use of user-supplied HTTP headers as a primary method for IP retrieval. This makes it possible for unauthenticated attackers spoof their IP address and submit forms that may have IP-based restrictions.
summary: This vulnerability in the Fluent Forms plugin for WordPress allows attackers to fake their IP address and submit forms that they should not have access to. This affects all users of the plugin up to version 5.2.12. Users should update to the latest version of the plugin to protect against this threat.

description: A vulnerability classified as problematic has been found in yangyouwang 杨有旺 crud 简约后台管理系统 1.0.0. Affected is an unknown function of the component Role Management Page. The manipulation leads to cross site scripting. It is possible to launch the attack remotely. The exploit has been disclosed to the public and may be used.
summary: This vulnerability in the yangyouwang crud management system allows for cross site scripting attacks to be launched remotely on the Role Management Page function. It is important for users of this system to take immediate action to prevent potential attacks by updating to a patched version of the software.
software: crud 简约后台管理系统

description: The Export and Import Users and Customers plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to Server-Side Request Forgery in all versions up to, and including, 2.6.2 via the validate_file() function. This makes it possible for authenticated attackers, with Administrator-level access and above, to make web requests to arbitrary locations originating from the web application and can be used to query and modify information from internal services.
summary: This vulnerability in the Export and Import Users and Customers plugin for WordPress could allow attackers with high-level access to the website to make unauthorized web requests to other websites. This could potentially compromise sensitive information from internal services. Users of this plugin should update to version 2.6.3 or remove the plugin altogether to reduce the risk of a security breach.
software: Export and Import Users and Customers plugin for WordPress

description: The Export and Import Users and Customers plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to PHP Object Injection in all versions up to, and including, 2.6.2 via deserialization of untrusted input from the 'form_data' parameter. This makes it possible for authenticated attackers, with Administrator-level access and above, to inject a PHP Object. No known POP chain is present in the vulnerable software, which means this vulnerability has no impact unless another plugin or theme containing a POP chain is installed on the site. If a POP chain is present via an additional plugin or theme installed on the target system, it may allow the attacker to perform actions like delete arbitrary files, retrieve sensitive data, or execute code depending on the POP chain present.
summary: The Export and Import Users and Customers plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to PHP Object Injection, allowing authenticated attackers with Administrator-level access and above to inject a PHP Object. This can only be exploited if another plugin or theme containing a specific type of vulnerability is also installed on the site. Users should update the plugin to version 2.6.3 to mitigate this risk.
software: Export and Import Users and Customers plugin for WordPress

description: The Export and Import Users and Customers plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to arbitrary file deletion due to insufficient file path validation in the admin_log_page() function in all versions up to, and including, 2.6.2. This makes it possible for authenticated attackers, with Administrator-level access and above, to delete arbitrary log files on the server.
summary: This plugin for WordPress has a security flaw that allows attackers with high-level access to delete important files on the server. If you are using the Export and Import Users and Customers plugin, it is important to update to version 2.6.3 or higher to protect against this vulnerability.
software: Export and Import Users and Customers plugin

description: The Export and Import Users and Customers plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to Path Traversal in all versions up to, and including, 2.6.2 via the download_file() function. This makes it possible for authenticated attackers, with Administrator-level access and above, to read the contents of arbitrary log files on the server, which can contain sensitive information.
summary: The Export and Import Users and Customers plugin for WordPress has a security vulnerability that allows authorized attackers with Administrator-level access to view sensitive information in server log files through a path traversal attack. Users of this plugin should update to version 2.6.3 or disable it to mitigate the risk of unauthorized data access.
software: Export and Import Users and Customers plugin for WordPress

description: The GiveWP – Donation Plugin and Fundraising Platform plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to Sensitive Information Exposure in all versions up to, and including, 3.22.1 via a misconfigured capability check in the 'permissionsCheck' function. This makes it possible for authenticated attackers, with Subscriber-level access and above, to extract sensitive data including reports detailing donors and donation amounts.
summary: The GiveWP plugin for WordPress is susceptible to a security flaw that allows attackers with certain levels of access to view sensitive information, such as reports listing donors and donation amounts. This affects all versions of the plugin up to 3.22.1. Website administrators should update the plugin to version 3.22.2 or newer to protect against this vulnerability.

description: The Bitspecter Suite plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to Stored Cross-Site Scripting via SVG File uploads in all versions up to, and including, 1.0.0 due to insufficient input sanitization and output escaping. This makes it possible for authenticated attackers, with Author-level access and above, to inject arbitrary web scripts in pages that will execute whenever a user accesses the SVG file.
summary: This vulnerability in the Bitspecter Suite plugin for WordPress allows attackers who are logged in with a certain level of access to inject harmful scripts into web pages using SVG file uploads. To protect against this threat, users should update the plugin to version 1.0.1 or higher, which includes a fix for this issue.

description:
** UNSUPPORTED WHEN ASSIGNED ** Improper Neutralization of Input During Web Page Generation ('Cross-site Scripting') vulnerability in Apache Oozie.

This issue affects Apache Oozie: all versions.

As this project is retired, we do not plan to release a version that fixes this issue. Users are recommended to find an alternative or restrict access to the instance to trusted users.

NOTE: This vulnerability only affects products that are no longer supported by the maintainer.
summary: The Apache Oozie software has a vulnerability that could allow attackers to inject malicious code into web pages, known as cross-site scripting. This affects all versions of Apache Oozie. Since the project is retired, there will not be a fix released. Users are advised to either find a different software solution or limit access to trusted users to mitigate the risk.

description: The Recover WooCommerce Cart Abandonment, Newsletter, Email Marketing, Marketing Automation By FunnelKit plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to SQL Injection via the ‘automationId’ parameter in all versions up to, and including, 3.5.1 due to insufficient escaping on the user supplied parameter and lack of sufficient preparation on the existing SQL query.  This makes it possible for unauthenticated attackers to append additional SQL queries into already existing queries that can be used to extract sensitive information from the database.
summary: The FunnelKit plugin for WordPress is at risk of a SQL Injection attack through a specific parameter, allowing attackers to access sensitive database information. This vulnerability affects users of the plugin up to version 3.5.1. To protect against this threat, users should update to the latest version of the plugin as soon as possible.

description: A vulnerability classified as problematic was found in yangyouwang 杨有旺 crud 简约后台管理系统 1.0.0. Affected by this vulnerability is an unknown functionality of the component Department Page. The manipulation leads to cross site scripting. The attack can be launched remotely. The exploit has been disclosed to the public and may be used.
summary: A vulnerability has been found in the yangyouwang crud management system version 1.0.0, which allows for cross site scripting attacks. This vulnerability can be exploited remotely, putting users of the system at risk. Users should update to a patched version or implement security measures to protect against this exploit.
software: crud 简约后台管理系统 1.0.0

description: A vulnerability, which was classified as critical, has been found in D-Link DAP-1620 1.03. Affected by this issue is the function set_ws_action of the file /dws/api/ of the component Path Handler. The manipulation leads to heap-based buffer overflow. The attack may be launched remotely. The exploit has been disclosed to the public and may be used. This vulnerability only affects products that are no longer supported by the maintainer.
summary: This vulnerability in D-Link DAP-1620 devices allows for a remote attacker to potentially cause a heap-based buffer overflow, leading to a critical security threat. This affects devices that are no longer supported by the manufacturer. Users should take caution and consider discontinuing the use of these devices to protect against potential attacks.

description: A vulnerability, which was classified as critical, was found in D-Link DAP-1620 1.03. This affects the function check_dws_cookie of the file /storage of the component Cookie Handler. The manipulation leads to stack-based buffer overflow. It is possible to initiate the attack remotely. The exploit has been disclosed to the public and may be used. This vulnerability only affects products that are no longer supported by the maintainer.
summary: A critical vulnerability has been found in the D-Link DAP-1620 1.03 router, where remote attackers can perform a stack-based buffer overflow through the Cookie Handler component. This exploit only affects products that are no longer supported by the manufacturer. Users of the D-Link DAP-1620 1.03 router should take action by updating to a supported version or replacing the device with a more secure model.

description: A vulnerability has been found in D-Link DAP-1620 1.03 and classified as critical. This vulnerability affects the function mod_graph_auth_uri_handler of the file /storage of the component Authentication Handler. The manipulation leads to stack-based buffer overflow. The attack can be initiated remotely. The exploit has been disclosed to the public and may be used. This vulnerability only affects products that are no longer supported by the maintainer.
summary: This vulnerability in the D-Link DAP-1620 1.03 allows for a remote stack-based buffer overflow attack on the Authentication Handler component, which can be exploited by manipulating the function mod_graph_auth_uri_handler. This only affects products that are no longer supported by D-Link. Users of D-Link DAP-1620 1.03 should be cautious and consider upgrading to a supported version to mitigate the risk of exploitation.

description: A vulnerability was found in D-Link DAP-1620 1.03 and classified as critical. This issue affects the function check_dws_cookie of the file /storage. The manipulation of the argument uid leads to stack-based buffer overflow. The attack may be initiated remotely. The exploit has been disclosed to the public and may be used. This vulnerability only affects products that are no longer supported by the maintainer.
summary: A critical vulnerability has been found in the D-Link DAP-1620 1.03 router, which could allow remote attackers to execute malicious code on the device. This vulnerability only affects products that are no longer supported by the manufacturer. Users of D-Link DAP-1620 1.03 should upgrade to a newer, supported model to avoid this security risk.

description: A vulnerability was found in aizuda snail-job 1.4.0. It has been classified as critical. Affected is the function getRuntime of the file /snail-job/workflow/check-node-expression of the component Workflow-Task Management Module. The manipulation of the argument nodeExpression leads to deserialization. It is possible to launch the attack remotely. The exploit has been disclosed to the public and may be used.
summary: The aizuda snail-job 1.4.0 software has a critical vulnerability that allows for remote attacks through manipulation of a specific argument. This vulnerability affects users of the Workflow-Task Management Module. To protect against potential exploits, users should consider updating their software to a version that addresses this vulnerability.

description: A vulnerability was found in westboy CicadasCMS 1.0. It has been declared as problematic. Affected by this vulnerability is an unknown functionality of the file /system/cms/content/save. The manipulation of the argument title/content/laiyuan leads to cross site scripting. The attack can be launched remotely. The exploit has been disclosed to the public and may be used.
summary: This vulnerability in CicadasCMS allows for cross-site scripting attacks through manipulation of certain file parameters. It can be exploited remotely and has been made public. Users of CicadasCMS 1.0 should update to a patched version to protect against this threat.

description: A vulnerability was found in westboy CicadasCMS 1.0. It has been rated as critical. Affected by this issue is some unknown functionality of the file /system/cms/content/save. The manipulation of the argument content/fujian/laiyuan leads to sql injection. The attack may be launched remotely. The exploit has been disclosed to the public and may be used.
summary: This CVE is a critical vulnerability in CicadasCMS 1.0 that allows for SQL injection through a specific file. The issue affects users of the CMS and can be exploited remotely. Users should update their CMS to a patched version to protect against potential attacks.

summary: A critical vulnerability has been discovered in CicadasCMS 1.0 that allows for SQL injection through manipulation of specific arguments. This vulnerability could be exploited remotely by attackers. Users of CicadasCMS 1.0 should take immediate action to patch or upgrade their systems to prevent exploitation of this vulnerability.

The manipulation of the argument ishot with the input 1 leads to improper authorization. It is possible to initiate the attack remotely. The exploit has been disclosed to the public and may be used.

description: A vulnerability has been found in JIZHICMS up to 1.7.0 and classified as problematic. This vulnerability affects unknown code of the file /user/release.html of the component Article Handler. The manipulation leads to improper authorization. The attack can be initiated remotely. The exploit has been disclosed to the public and may be used.
summary: This vulnerability in JIZHICMS up to version 1.7.0 allows for unauthorized access to certain files, specifically in the Article Handler component. This issue affects some unknown processing of the file /doctor/appointment-bwdates-reports-details.php. The manipulation of the argument fromdate/todate leads to sql injection. summary: This vulnerability in the PHPGurukul Doctor Appointment Management System allows attackers to execute SQL injections through manipulation of specific files. Affected by this issue is some unknown functionality of the file /admin/edit-artist-detail.php?editid=1. The manipulation of the argument Name leads to sql injection. description: The Nested Pages WordPress plugin before 3.2.13 does not sanitise and escape some of its settings, which could allow high privilege users such as contributors to perform Stored Cross-Site Scripting attacks even when the unfiltered_html capability is disallowed (for example in multisite setup).
summary: The Nested Pages WordPress plugin before version 3.2.13 is vulnerable to a Stored Cross-Site Scripting attack. This allows high privilege users like contributors to execute malicious scripts on the site, even if certain security measures are in place. Users of this plugin should update to version 3.2.13 or higher to protect against this vulnerability.

description: The Pods  WordPress plugin before 3.2.8.2 does not sanitize and escape a parameter before using it in a SQL statement, allowing admins to perform SQL injection attacks
summary: A vulnerability in the Pods WordPress plugin before version 3.2.8.2 allows malicious administrators to execute SQL injection attacks. This could impact users of the plugin who have admin privileges. To protect against this threat, users should update to version 3.2.8.2 or later to mitigate the risk of SQL injection attacks.

This affects an unknown part of the file /admin/edit-art-product-detail.php?editid=2. The manipulation of the argument editide/sprice/description leads to sql injection. It is possible to initiate the attack remotely. The exploit has been disclosed to the public and may be used.
summary: The PHPGurukul Art Gallery Management System 1.0 has a critical vulnerability that allows for SQL injection when editing art product details. This could be exploited remotely by manipulating a specific argument in the file. Users of this software should update to a patched version or take other measures to protect against potential attacks.

description: A vulnerability has been found in PHPGurukul Art Gallery Management System 1.0 and classified as critical. This vulnerability affects unknown code of the file /admin/edit-art-type-detail.php?editid=1. The manipulation of the argument arttype leads to sql injection. The attack can be initiated remotely. The exploit has been disclosed to the public and may be used.
summary: This is a critical vulnerability in the PHPGurukul Art Gallery Management System that allows for SQL injection through a specific file. This can be exploited remotely by attackers. It is important for users of this system to update to a patched version or take other security measures to protect against this threat.

description: A vulnerability was found in PHPGurukul Art Gallery Management System 1.0 and classified as critical. This issue affects some unknown processing of the file /admin/add-art-product.php. The manipulation of the argument arttype leads to sql injection. The attack may be initiated remotely. The exploit has been disclosed to the public and may be used.
summary: This vulnerability in PHPGurukul Art Gallery Management System 1.0 can allow hackers to execute SQL injection attacks by manipulating a specific file. This issue may affect users of the Art Gallery Management System who have not taken necessary security precautions. It is important to update the system to the latest version or patch provided by the vendor to prevent potential attacks.

description: A vulnerability was found in PHPGurukul Art Gallery Management System 1.0. It has been classified as problematic. Affected is an unknown function of the file /product.php. The manipulation of the argument artname leads to cross site scripting. It is possible to launch the attack remotely. The exploit has been disclosed to the public and may be used.
summary: The PHPGurukul Art Gallery Management System 1.0 has a vulnerability that allows for cross-site scripting attacks by manipulating certain arguments in the product.php file. This could affect users of the system and allow attackers to remotely launch the attack. It is recommended to update the software to a version that has patched this vulnerability to protect against potential attacks.

description: A vulnerability was found in PHPGurukul Art Gallery Management System 1.0. It has been declared as critical. Affected by this vulnerability is an unknown functionality of the file /admin/admin-profile.php. The manipulation of the argument contactnumber leads to sql injection. The attack can be launched remotely. The exploit has been disclosed to the public and may be used. Other parameters might be affected as well.
summary: This vulnerability in PHPGurukul Art Gallery Management System 1.0 allows for remote SQL injection through the file /admin/admin-profile.php. This could potentially be exploited by malicious actors. Users of this system should take immediate action to update or patch the software to protect against this vulnerability.

description: A vulnerability was found in PHPGurukul Art Gallery Management System 1.0. It has been rated as critical. Affected by this issue is some unknown functionality of the file /search.php. The manipulation of the argument Search leads to sql injection. The attack may be launched remotely. The exploit has been disclosed to the public and may be used.
summary: The PHPGurukul Art Gallery Management System 1.0 has a critical vulnerability that allows SQL injection via the search functionality in search.php. This vulnerability can be exploited remotely, and it is recommended to update the software to a patched version to prevent any potential attacks.

description: A vulnerability classified as critical has been found in PHPGurukul Art Gallery Management System 1.0. This affects an unknown part of the file /admin/view-enquiry-detail.php. The manipulation of the argument viewid leads to sql injection. It is possible to initiate the attack remotely. The exploit has been disclosed to the public and may be used.
summary: A critical vulnerability has been found in PHPGurukul Art Gallery Management System 1.0, which allows for remote SQL injection through manipulation of the viewid argument in the file /admin/view-enquiry-detail.php. This could potentially affect anyone using this system. To mitigate the risk, users should update to a newer version of the software that has addressed this vulnerability.

The manipulation of the argument searchdata leads to sql injection. The attack can be initiated remotely. The exploit has been disclosed to the public and may be used.
summary: This vulnerability in the PHPGurukul Doctor Appointment Management System could allow hackers to inject malicious SQL code through a certain file, potentially compromising sensitive information. It can be exploited remotely, and the details of the exploit have been made public. Users of this system should update to a secure version and be cautious of any suspicious activity.

description: A vulnerability, which was classified as problematic, has been found in PHPGurukul Medical Card Generation System 1.0. This issue affects some unknown processing of the file /download-medical-cards.php. The manipulation of the argument searchdata leads to cross site scripting. The attack may be initiated remotely. The exploit has been disclosed to the public and may be used.
summary: This vulnerability in the PHPGurukul Medical Card Generation System 1.0 allows for cross-site scripting attacks through manipulation of a specific file. This could be exploited remotely by an attacker. Users of this system should take immediate action to update or patch the vulnerability to prevent any potential attacks.

description: Attila Szász discovered that the HFS+ file system implementation in the Linux Kernel contained a heap overflow vulnerability. An attacker could use a specially crafted file system image that, when mounted, could cause a denial of service (system crash) or possibly execute arbitrary code.
summary: This CVE is about a vulnerability in the HFS+ file system implementation in the Linux Kernel which could allow an attacker to crash the system or run malicious code by using a specially crafted file system image. Users of Linux systems that use the HFS+ file system should update their operating system to the latest version to patch this vulnerability.

description:
Relative Path Traversal vulnerability in Apache Commons VFS before 2.10.0.

The FileObject API in Commons VFS has a 'resolveFile' method that
takes a 'scope' parameter. Specifying 'NameScope.DESCENDENT' promises that "an exception is thrown if the resolved file is not a descendent of
the base file". However, when the path contains encoded ".."
characters (for example, "%2E%2E/bar.txt"), it might return file objects that are not
a descendent of the base file, without throwing an exception.
This issue affects Apache Commons VFS: before 2.10.0.

Users are recommended to upgrade to version 2.10.0, which fixes the issue.
summary: The Apache Commons VFS software before version 2.10.0 is vulnerable to a Relative Path Traversal. This vulnerability allows an attacker to access files outside of the intended directory by using specific encoded characters in the file path. This vulnerability affects users of Apache Commons VFS before version 2.10.0. To mitigate this threat, users should update to version 2.10.0 or later to address the issue and prevent unauthorized access to files.

description: A vulnerability, which was classified as problematic, was found in SourceCodester Online Eyewear Shop 1.0. Affected is an unknown function of the file /oews/admin/. The manipulation leads to exposure of information through directory listing. It is possible to launch the attack remotely. The exploit has been disclosed to the public and may be used. It is recommended to change the configuration settings. Multiple sub-directories are affected.
summary: The SourceCodester Online Eyewear Shop 1.0 has a vulnerability that allows attackers to access sensitive information by manipulating the /oews/admin/ file. This can be exploited remotely and multiple sub-directories are affected. To protect against this, users should change their configuration settings to prevent unauthorized access to their information.

description: A vulnerability has been found in SourceCodester Employee and Visitor Gate Pass Logging System 1.0 and classified as problematic. Affected by this vulnerability is an unknown functionality. The manipulation leads to exposure of information through directory listing. The attack can be launched remotely. The exploit has been disclosed to the public and may be used. It is recommended to change the configuration settings. Multiple sub-directories are affected.
summary: The SourceCodester Employee and Visitor Gate Pass Logging System 1.0 has a vulnerability that allows remote attackers to access sensitive information through directory listing. This issue affects multiple sub-directories and has been disclosed publicly, making it a potential target for exploitation. Users should change their configuration settings to protect against this threat.
software: SourceCodester Employee and Visitor Gate Pass Logging System 1.0

description: Versions of the package nossrf before 1.0.4 are vulnerable to Server-Side Request Forgery (SSRF) where an attacker can provide a hostname that resolves to a local or reserved IP address space and bypass the SSRF protection mechanism.
summary: This CVE (Common Vulnerabilities and Exposures) affects versions of the nossrf package before 1.0.4. It allows an attacker to trick a server into making requests to internal or restricted IP addresses, potentially leading to unauthorized access or data leaks. To protect against this vulnerability, users should update to version 1.0.4 or newer of the nossrf package.

description:
Exposure of Sensitive Information to an Unauthorized Actor vulnerability in Apache Commons VFS.

The FtpFileObject class can throw an exception when a file is not found, revealing the original URI in its message, which may include a password. The fix is to mask the password in the exception message
This issue affects Apache Commons VFS: before 2.10.0.

Users are recommended to upgrade to version 2.10.0, which fixes the issue.
summary: The vulnerability in Apache Commons VFS can expose sensitive information, such as passwords, to unauthorized actors through error messages. This impacts users of Apache Commons VFS prior to version 2.10.0. To protect against this threat, users should upgrade to version 2.10.0, which masks passwords in error messages.

description: A vulnerability was found in FoxCMS 1.25 and classified as problematic. Affected by this issue is some unknown functionality. The manipulation leads to improper authorization. The attack may be launched remotely. The exploit has been disclosed to the public and may be used.
summary: The CVE is a vulnerability in FoxCMS 1.25 that allows for improper authorization, which could be exploited remotely. This could potentially impact users of the FoxCMS platform. To mitigate the risk, users should update to a patched version of the software as soon as possible.

The exploit has been disclosed to the public and may be used.

It is classified as critical and has been publicly disclosed, increasing the risk of exploitation. Users should update the software to the latest version or apply any available patches to mitigate the risk of attacks.
software: SourceCodester AC Repair and Services System

description: Improper link resolution before file access ('link following') in Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) allows an authorized attacker to elevate privileges locally.
summary: This vulnerability in Microsoft Edge allows a hacker with authorized access to the system to gain higher privileges locally, which could lead to further attacks or data breaches. Users should update their Microsoft Edge browser to the latest version to prevent exploitation of this vulnerability.

description: No cwe for this issue in Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) allows an unauthorized attacker to execute code over a network.
summary: A vulnerability in Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) allows hackers to run malicious code remotely, potentially compromising user data and system security. All users of Microsoft Edge are affected and should update to the latest version to patch this vulnerability.

description: A vulnerability was found in SourceCodester AC Repair and Services System 1.0. It has been declared as critical. This vulnerability affects the function save_users of the file /classes/Users.php. The manipulation of the argument ID leads to sql injection. The attack can be initiated remotely. The exploit has been disclosed to the public and may be used. Other parameters might be affected as well.

This vulnerability can be exploited remotely and may affect other parameters. Users of this system should update to a patched version to protect against potential attacks.
software: SourceCodester AC Repair and Services System
